alert.note: Alert for Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 2:22AM EST until January 11 at 1:45AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in West Virginia... Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. For the Cacapon River...including Great Cacapon...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Cacapon River near Great Cacapon. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Rock Ford Road begins to flood in multiple locations, including flowing completely over the low water bridge. Constant Run Road and a small portion of Kilgore Road also begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 2.1 feet, or 6.9 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Cacapon River Great Cacapo 9.0 2.1 Tue 1 am 2.3 2.7 3.7 9.6 1pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM EST.
